Types

PObjectType = OrderedTable[string, PrefsNode]
Prefs ordered table type 
PrefsNKind = enum
  PEmpty, PInt, PNil, PSeq, PBool, PChar, PFloat, PObject, PString
Valid node kinds for PrefsNode 
PrefsNode = ref PrefsNodeObj
Reference to PrefsNodeObj 
PrefsNodeObj = object
  case kind*: PrefsNKind
  of PInt:
      intV*: int

  of PNil:
      nil

  of PSeq:
      seqV*: PSeqType

  of PBool:
      boolV*: bool

  of PChar:
      charV*: char

  of PEmpty:
      nil

  of PFloat:
      floatV*: float

  of PObject:
      objectV*: PObjectType

  of PString:
      stringV*: string
Object variant 
PSeqParam = openArray[PrefsNode]
Used for as the parameter for sequence type 
PSeqType = seq[PrefsNode]
Prefs sequence type

Procs

proc `$`(node: PrefsNode): string {....raises: [], tags: [].}
Return the value of the node as a string. 
proc `==`(node1: PrefsNode; node2: PrefsNode): bool {....raises: [], tags: [].}
Checks if two nodes of the same kind have the same value 
proc `==`[T: not PrefsNode](node1: PrefsNode; node2: T): bool

Checks if two nodes of the same kind have the same value

Converts node2 to PrefsNode using newPNode.

proc `[]=`(node: var PrefsNode; key: string; val: PrefsNode) {....raises: [],
    tags: [].}
Change the value of the key in node's table

Example:

var table = toPrefs {"lang": "en"}
table["users"] = toPrefs @["ElegantBeef", "Patitotective"]
proc `[]=`[T: not PrefsNode](node: var PrefsNode; key: string; val: T)
Change the value of the key in node's table The given value is converted to PrefsNode` with newPNode

Example:

var table = toPrefs {"lang": "en"}
table["lang"] = "es"

Macros

macro toPrefs(obj: untyped): PrefsNode
Converts the given object into a PrefsNode if possible
  • Arrays are converted into sequences
  • {key: val, ..} are converted to ordered tables.

Example:

var table = toPrefs({
  "lang": "es",
  "dark": true,
  "users": @[],
  "names": [],
  "keybindings": {: },
  "scheme": {
    "background": "#000000",
    "font": "UbuntuMono"
  }
}).getObject()
